intro: Calophanes maranhonis, commonly known as the Maranhão calophane, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
